body:
stalemating sucks!!

to prevent it just make the obsidian become easier to break like morph the block like on ocn which makes it easier to break 

Oby: start
Beacon 10 mins
Coal block 20 mins
Gold 35 mins
Ice 50 mins

title: Stalemate  prevention

replies.body:
This has been suggested before. And the reason of stalemates most of the time is not because of how long it takes to break the obsidian, that's only a very small factor.
Most of the time when stalemates happen, it's because either:
1. People are bow spamming like they're life will die without doing it.
2. There is one monument left and half the team is defending that one monument while the opposition is attacking 1 by 1 making it near to impossible to actually make it to the monument.

There really is no fix to stalemate, it's just on how the players in the game decide to play.

1. People are bow spamming like they're life will die without doing it.
2. There is one monument left and half the team is defending that one monument while the opposition is attacking 1 by 1 making it near to impossible to actually make it to the monument.

There really is no fix to stalemate, it's just on how the players in the game decide to play.

replies.body:
Hmm what if you instead of turning the monuments into different blocks make all the pickaxes more efficient as time progresses.

Pickaxe efficiency increases every 10 minutes to prevent Stalemate

replies.body:
map making 101: always ensure that the map has flow 
the items make no difference, trust me. The actual map itself needs to be dramatically changed

crescent chaos shows this perfectly, which is why there's a lot of circles - and it's barely stalemate

replies.body:
I still think it's a very Overcast thing to do.

Besides, it's not like stalemates are a constant problem on Avicus, it's not something that needs to be fixed.

And personally, I love long games.
It creates awesome moments and set pieces.

Agreed.
Long games are much more fun in my opinion.

replies.body:
IMO matters what map is being stalemated.

A map like Quintus or Ternio can be stalemated for a very long time and still be fun. A map like Campi can only be stalemated for a certain amount of time and maps like Ravanged aren't fun stalemates.
